remarks: A version of ~ evth using bound-variable hypotheses instead of distinct variable conditions.  (Contributed by Glauco Siliprandi, 20-Apr-2017.)
statement:
evthf.1 $e |- F/_ x F $.
evthf.2 $e |- F/_ y F $.
evthf.3 $e |- F/_ x X $.
evthf.4 $e |- F/_ y X $.
evthf.5 $e |- F/ x ph $.
evthf.6 $e |- F/ y ph $.
evthf.7 $e |- X = U. J $.
evthf.8 $e |- K = ( topGen ` ran (,) ) $.
evthf.9 $e |- ( ph -> J e. Comp ) $.
evthf.10 $e |- ( ph -> F e. ( J Cn K ) ) $.
evthf.11 $e |- ( ph -> X =/= (/) ) $.
evthf $p |- ( ph -> E. x e. X A. y e. X ( F ` y ) <_ ( F ` x ) ) $.
$d x y $.
